text: Infinix made its first foldable smartphone, the Zero Flip, official in September. And now it's finally ready to make its debut in India. The phone will launch in India on October 17. html:
Infinix made its first foldable smartphone, the Zero Flip, official in September. And now it's finally ready to make its debut in India.

The phone will launch in India on October 17. Pricing and release information will be unveiled on that occasion. Ahead of the event, Infinix has already started teasing the device in the Indian market.

The Zero Flip comes with a 6.9-inch foldable AMOLED touchscreen with 120 Hz refresh rate and 1,400-nit peak brightness, a 3.64-inch 1056x1066 cover display with Gorilla Glass 2 on top, the MediaTek Dimensity 8020 SoC, 8GB of RAM, 512GB of storage, a 50 MP main camera with OIS, a 50 MP ultrawide, a 50 MP selfie camera, and a 4,720 mAh battery with support for 70W wired and 10W reverse wired charging. It runs Android 14 and is promised two major Android updates.
